alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 3:50PM EDT until August 21 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Central Ohio, including the following county, Franklin OH. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 348 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Although the heaviest rain has ended, additional storms will be possible over the next hour or so, with additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch possible. - Additional rainfall of 0.5 to 1 inch is expected over the area.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
